description: A Hong Kong pro-democracy activist reportedly tortured in China may have been the source through which China-backed hackers accessed emails of Canadian parliamentarians, a global legislative coalition director told a House of Commons committee. Luke de Pulford, executive director of the global coalition Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China (IPAC), made the comment on Sept. 26 in […]
title: Chinese Hackers Likely Got Parliamentarians’ Emails From Volunteer Tortured in China, Committee Told

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged foreign leaders to oppose Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s effort “to strengthen his own grip on power,” during a Thursday meeting with foreign ministers in New York. The U.S. government has imposed sanctions against the Maduro regime and several allies in response to Venezuela’s disputed July presidential election. The United […]
title: Blinken Urges Foreign Ministers to Oppose Maduro’s Post-Election Power Grab in Venezuela

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: 5-Count Indictment, More Military Aids, and a Landing Hurricane

description: On the campaign trail in B.C. on Sept. 26, the provincial Conservative Party released a plan to cut power costs for communities in the Northwest, while the NDP said it’d boost the number of people who could train for a trade, and the Greens announced a plan to cut the cost of carbon taxes. Conservative […]
title: BC Conservatives Promise to Reduce Power Costs in NW, NDP Says It’ll Boost Trades Training

description: Former Conservative MP Kenny Chiu says he has raised concerns with authorities investigating foreign interference about a veiled “warning” issued by a former Chinese consul-general in Vancouver. Chiu told The Epoch Times that he was concerned about remarks made by Tong Xiaoling during a July 2020 interview with the Vancouver-based Chinese language radio station AM1320. […]
title: Chinese Consul-General in Vancouver Issued Veiled ‘Warning’ to Canadian Politicians, Former MP Says

description: Things may get heated in the House of Commons sometimes, but the weapon of choice has been words—most of the time.The most recent fracas in the House occurred last week when Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre called NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh a “sellout,” and Singh reportedly left his seat to yell at Poilievre. Singh ended his […]
title: A History of Parliamentary Scuffles

description: Canada’s new military chief says she aims to fill all the vacancies in her organization within five years, as she prioritizes retention and changing recruitment methods to diversify the ranks. “I’m committed to building on the work of my predecessors, that means focusing on the three Rs: recruitment, retention and readiness,” Gen. Jennie Carignan told […]
title: New Military Chief Aims to Reach Full Troop Strength Within 5 Years

description: As the political parties in New Brunswick continue on the campaign trail, the Liberal party focused on mental health services, while the PC party said it wants to see more youth gaining financial literacy, while the Greens want a cap on rental prices. The New Brunswick Liberal Party has released a $4.7 million commitment to […]
title: NB Election: Liberals Announce New Mental Health Supports, PCs Pledge Financial Literacy Education, Greens Look to Cap Rents

description: A man who allegedly committed acts of elder abuse has been instructed to pay punitive damages to an elderly British Columbia woman with dementia and forfeit his stake in her $1.2 million home. B.C. Supreme Court Justice Sheri Ann Donegan described Zoltan Vimhel as a “predator” whose alleged treatment of Judith King was “egregious,” in […]
title: BC Judge Rules ‘Predator’ to Lose Stake in Elderly Woman’s $1.2M Home

description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with professors Martin Neil and Norman Fenton to talk about their new book, which explores the science and data used to make decisions during the COVID-19 pandemic.
title: We Need to Keep Asking Questions About COVID-19 and the Lockdowns: Martin Neil & Norman Fenton

description: The Ukrainian president is set to share his plan for victory against Russia, and discuss continuing U.S. support for his country.
title: Biden, Harris Host Zelenskyy to Discuss Next Steps in Russia–Ukraine War

description: The Conservative Party has introduced a new non-confidence motion to take down the minority Liberal government, a day after a previous motion to do so failed in the House of Commons. On Sept. 25, the Tories’ first non-confidence motion was defeated, receiving 211 “nay” votes and 120 “yea” votes, with the Liberals, NDP, Bloc Québécois, […]
title: Tories Introduce New Non-Confidence Motion, Bloc and NDP Unlikely to Support

description: A senior federal official says the government is mulling new ways to inform the public about possible foreign interference developments during an election campaign. Under the current system, a panel of five top bureaucrats would issue a public warning if they believed an incident—or an accumulation of incidents—threatened Canada’s ability to have a free and […]
title: Feds Eyeing New Ways to Publicly Flag Possible Foreign Interference During Elections

description: The wildfire that prompted a now-rescinded evacuation order for the community of Grand Forks, B.C., has grown to about four square kilometres in size. That’s up from two square kilometres after the out-of-control fire was discovered Wednesday, south of the U.S. border. The Regional District of Kootenay Boundary had issued an evacuation order Wednesday afternoon, […]
title: Grand Forks, BC, Remains on Alert Due to Washington State Wildfire

description: The Quebec government is going to court to fight the dumping of contaminated soil along a shoreline in the Mohawk community of Kanesatake, west of Montreal. The Environment Department is seeking an injunction in Quebec Superior Court to stop the dumping of soil and waste material, tree-cutting and the construction of new buildings on 17 […]
title: Quebec Seeks Injunction Against Dumping of Contaminated Soil in Kanesatake

description: Chinese-language media in Canada are playing a key role in promoting pro-Beijing narratives and facilitating censorship within the Chinese diaspora, according to recently released intelligence assessment. Released by the Foreign Interference Commission on Sept. 24, the heavily-redacted report is a joint assessment by the Canadian Security Intelligence Service and the Privy Council Office on how […]
title: Pro-CCP Narratives Dominate Chinese-Language Media in Canada, Intel Report Says

description: The Ontario government is planning to construct an expressway tunnel beneath Highway 401 to ease gridlock throughout the densely populated Toronto region. Premier Doug Ford announced the concept at a Toronto press conference alongside a congested section of the 401, saying the project, which is currently the subject of a feasibility study, will be moving […]
title: Premier Ford Vows to Build Expressway Tunnel Under Ontario’s Highway 401

description: This marks the first prison term handed down by Hong Kong's court in a sedition case against journalists since the city's handover to Beijing in 1997.
title: Hong Kong Journalist Sentenced to 21-Month Prison Term in Landmark Sedition Case

description: The chief medical officer gave evidence to the COVID Inquiry, saying he still worries whether or not the government 'got the balance right' in public messaging.
title: Chris Whitty Tells Inquiry He Worries Danger of COVID-19 Was ‘Overstated’

description: This month also saw the announcement of the closure of Scotland's only oil refinery and that 2,800 job will be lost at a steel mill in Wales.
title: UK’s Last Coal-Fired Power Station to Close

description: The Canada Mortgage and Housing Corp. says construction of new homes in Canada’s six largest cities rose four percent year-over-year during the first half of 2024, but housing starts were still not enough to meet growing demand. The agency said Thursday the growth in housing starts was driven by significant gains in Calgary, Edmonton and […]
title: Housing Starts up in Six Largest Cities but Construction Still Not Closing Supply Gap

description: The European Court of Auditors report into the EU's Emergency Trust Fund for Africa has found thousands are still making the journey.
title: Despite Spending Billions, the EU is Failing to Deter Illegal Crossings from Africa

description: Health Canada has authorized the updated COVID-19 vaccine from Pfizer-BioNTech this week, making it the third vaccine formulation to receive approval this month. The mRNA vaccine developed by Pfizer-BioNTech is designed to target the KP.2 subvariant of Omicron. Known as Comirnaty, the new vaccine replaces the prior shot that was meant to protect against the […]
title: Health Canada Approves Updated Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine

description: Lawmakers in South Korea warned that Kim Jong Un is making progress to produce weapon-grade nuclear materials to develop more powerful and accurate bombs.
title: North Korea Enriching Enough Uranium for ‘Double-Digit’ Amount Of Nuclear Weapons, Says Spy Agency

description: TOKYO—A Japanese court found an 88-year-old former boxer not guilty on Thursday after a retrial for a 1966 quadruple murder, reversing a decision that made him the world’s longest-serving death row inmate. Iwao Hakamada’s acquittal by the Shizuoka District Court makes him the fifth death row inmate to be found not guilty in a retrial […]
title: Japanese Court Acquits Longest-Serving Death Row Inmate of 1966 Quadruple Murder

description: Nigel Gambier has always been proud of his ancestor, who captained one of the ill-starred ships on Sir John Franklin’s disastrous expedition in search of the Northwest Passage. Now, after DNA analysis has identified the remains of Gambier’s predecessor and confirmed his relationship with James Fitzjames, there’s sorrow mixed in with the pride. “He’s a […]
title: Pride, Sorrow Mix for Franklin Expedition Descendant After DNA Match With Sailor

description: While the Conservatives have been clear that they want an election today, a second federal party—the Bloc Québécois—this week left no ambiguity as to its position on forcing an early election, saying it wants passage of two key bills before November in order to retain its support of the Liberals. The NDP, meanwhile, has said […]
title: ANALYSIS: Snap Election Showdown: Crucial Next Few Weeks

description: Visual effects and animation companies are uniting to strike a better deal with the Quebec government after it implemented tax changes that some firms say will cost them nearly two-thirds of their revenues next year. Last spring, the provincial government added in the budget a 65 percent cap on tax credits that international film studios […]
title: Visual Effects, Animation Studios Unite to Convince Quebec for Better Tax Deal

description: The chief of Elections Canada says he does not have the resources to oversee party nominations, which have been flagged as vulnerable to foreign interference, and that doing so would impede on political freedom. Chief Electoral Officer Stéphane Perrault, who testified at the Foreign Interference Commission on Sept. 24, said there were around 1,500 nomination […]
title: Elections Chief Says No Capacity to Oversee Party Nominations Amid Foreign Interference Concerns

description: During a two-day trip to the U.N., Sir Keir Starmer is to condemn Russia over actions in Ukraine and call for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and Lebanon.
title: UK Will Return to ‘Responsible Global Leadership’: Starmer

description: Canada has issued a joint statement with its allies calling for “an immediate 21-day ceasefire across the Lebanon-Israel border,” citing an “unacceptable risk of a broader regional escalation.” The statement, issued along with the United States, Australia, European Union, United Arab Emirates and eight other countries, calls on the governments of Lebanon and Israel and […]
title: Canada and Allies Call for Immediate 21-day Ceasefire Between Lebanon and Israel

description: U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin, Australian Defense Minister Richard Marles, and British Defense Secretary John Healey hold a joint press conference following an AUKUS defense ministerial meeting in London, at 9:45 a.m. ET on Sept. 26. During their meeting, the defense leaders discuss Pillars I and II of AUKUS, a trilateral security partnership intended […]
title: LIVE NOW: AUKUS Defense Leaders Hold Briefing on Security Partnership

description: Caroline Xavier, the chief of Canada’s cyberspy agency, is slated to appear at a federal inquiry into foreign interference today. Xavier was appointed in 2022 to lead the Communications Security Establishment, which has a lead role in fending off online threats to Canada. Other senior officials from the CSE are also scheduled to testify along […]
title: Chief Cyberspy Among Federal Officials Appearing at Meddling Inquiry Today

description: Deloitte Canada expects economic growth to pick up next year as it forecasts the Bank of Canada to cut its key interest rate below three percent by mid-2025. In the company’s fall economic outlook released Thursday, it forecasts the central bank’s interest rate will fall to 3.75 percent by the end of this year and […]
title: Economy to Grow Moderately, Rates to Fall Below Three Percent Next Year: Deloitte

description: 'We are sincerely sorry,' the EnergyAustralia managing director said.
title: Energy Giant Fined $14 Million for Failing to Let Customers Know About Cheaper Deals

description: The United States, UK, France, Germany, Japan and several other nations have called for an immediate 21-day ceasefire across the Israel-Lebanon border
title: Lebanese Prime Minister Hopeful of Ceasefire Amid US Calls for 21-Day Truce

description: President Joe Biden is set to meet with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday.
title: Biden Announces Billions More in Military Aid for Ukraine

description: The International Monetary Fund welcomed Pakistan's economic progress but warned that vulnerabilities and structural challenges remain an issue.
title: IMF Approves a $7 Billion Loan for Pakistan to Help Ailing Economy

description: Opposition senator Luis Donaldo Colosio said it would 'normalize' the idea that only the military could restore peace and law and order in Mexico.
title: Mexican Senate Votes to Put National Guard Under Military Control

description: Nine youths are being arrested every day in Victoria, as police lay blame for figures on repeat offending and population growth.
title: Youth Crime in Victoria Surges by 23 Percent

description: Ukrainian president has been rallying support ahead of the meeting.
title: Zelenskyy to Meet With Biden, Harris to Present ‘Victory Plan’

description: The U.S. president said that solving one problem through a settlement in the region could lead to resolving other problems.
title: Biden: All-Out War or Settlement Both Possible in Middle East

description: The Albanese government faces dilemma on negative gearing as the Greens push for reform. Meanwhile, the Coalition backs the status quo.
title: Dutton Rejects Negative Gearing Changes

description: It’s a dinosaur that roamed Alberta’s badlands more than 70 million years ago, sporting a big, bumpy, bony head the size of a baby elephant. On Wednesday, paleontologists near Grande Prairie pulled its 272-kilogram skull from the ground. They call it “Big Sam.” The adult Pachyrhinosaurus is the second plant-eating dinosaur to be unearthed from […]
title: ‘Big Sam’: Paleontologists Unearth Giant Skull of Pachyrhinosaurus in Alberta

description: Wildfire officials say an evacuation order for the B.C. southern Interior town of Grand Forks, has been downgraded to an alert, even as an out-of-control wildfire in Washington state surges north and threatens to cross the border. The Regional District of Kootenay Boundary says residents must be ready to leave at a moment’s notice since […]
title: Evacuation Orders Near Grand Forks, BC, Downgraded, but US Fire Is Still a Threat

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau welcomed French President Emmanuel Macron to his home in Ottawa Wednesday for an informal private dinner. Trudeau greeted Macron outside Rideau Cottage with a hug and a big smile at the start of Macron’s second official visit to Canada. The two leaders will hold more formal meetings Thursday in Ottawa and […]
title: Macron, Trudeau Meet as French President Visits Canada

description: Canada’s foreign ministry expressed alarm about its shrinking ability to counter foreign disinformation online due to limited access to data and the evolving tactics of adversaries, a newly released memo shows. The memo, tabled Wednesday at a federal inquiry into foreign interference, noted Canada had led the G7 Rapid Response Mechanism to identify and respond […]
title: Foreign Ministry Rang Alarm Bell Over Challenges in Countering Disinformation Online

description: In his first public appearance since being freed from a UK prison, Assange will address the Council of Europe in October.
title: Julian Assange to Make First Post-Release Public Appearance

description: Across Australia, there were 330,000 job vacancies in August 2024, down by 18,000 from May.
title: August Sees Job Vacancy Reductions Across 11 Industries, ABS Reports

description: The Pacific Island of Bougainville continues its push for independence.
title: Former NZ Governor General Appointed to Troubleshoot Pacific Island’s Path to Independence

description: Qantas travellers put on alert for flight disruptions as its engineers staged a fortnight industrial action in Melbourne.
title: Qantas Flights Will Meet Severe Disruptions As Unions Strike For More Pay

description: Sydney and Brisbane added the largest number of million-dollar suburbs, while Melbourne stagnated.
title: Record Number of Australian Homes Now Cost More Than $1 Million: CoreLogic

description: Despite Canberra working hard to build a stronger relationship with Beijing, there remain significant trade barriers to Australian goods.
title: Beijing Failing to Progress Trade Agreements, Australia Says

description: Debate over negative gearing reforms has intensified after reports surfaced that the government asked Treasury to model potential tax changes.
title: Albanese Rules Out Negative Gearing Changes, Says Investors Key to Increasing Housing Supply

description: More than 100 Falun Gong practitioners gathered in front of the United Nations’ headquarters in New York City on Sept. 25 to call for an end to the Chinese Communist Party’s (CCP’s) ongoing persecution of Falun Gong and the regime’s human rights abuses, during the week-long U.N. General Assembly meetings. “This persecution has already gone on […]
title: Falun Gong Practitioners Urge World Leaders at UN to Stand Against CCP Persecution

description: Penny Wong has repeated warnings to Australians to get out of Lebanon, saying it was beyond the government's capacity to evacuate every citizen.
title: Australians Warned Again to Leave Lebanon Amid Israel’s War With Hezbollah

description: The latest hearing in a legal challenge of Saskatchewan’s school pronoun policy wrapped up on Sept. 24, with the court reserving its decision. The Saskatchewan government introduced the policy in August 2023, requiring schools to seek parental consent if a student wants to change his or her name or pronoun. The policy was challenged by […]
title: Hearing Concludes in Sask. School Pronoun Policy Court Challenge

description: President Vladimir Putin said Moscow could use the weapons against any nuclear nations that attack Russian territory.
title: Russia Considers Allowing Use of Nuclear Weapons Against Ukraine’s Supporters
